subject: Attention,
body:
Attention,
I am writing to notify you that I need your consent with respect to
payment of Sixteen Million Five Hundred Thousand United State
Dollars($16,500,000.00) in (BBG) Barclays Bank Ghana Plc. Where I am
the branch manager belonging to a deceased customer whose name is not
stated in this mail for reasons of privacy. My last check on
Investor's deposits revealed an inactive account with the above
stated amount belonging to a deceased customer.
The records for this deposit showed no beneficiary in the event of
death of the depositor. I want you to act as the beneficiary of the
funds and I would like to meet you face to face for verbal discussion,
there is no risk involves, note that the money is going to be shared
between me and you, I am going to offer you 45% of the total sums, because
55% will be for me.
For further inquiries/interest in this claim, send to me your full
name immediately as they are in your driver's license or international
passport, your mobile telephone number, your fax number if
confidential and your contact address for the legal documentations of
this claim. In receipt of your positive response, I will update you
with the entire legal requirement for this claim. I will also prove
to.
You the decease death certificate upon your response with the
certificate of deposit of the fund, Please note it's very confidential
which is infrastructure security to avoid the head office knowing,
As i wait for your kind response,
Yours faithfully
Mr Elvis Lawer Nanor,
Regional Remittance Manager
Email Address; 
elvislawer7@gmail.com
Barclays Bank Ghana Plc

subject: Re:   Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this information. It's quite a surprise to hear about such a large sum of money! I must admit, I'm not familiar with these types of transactions.

Could you please explain more about how this process works? And what exactly does it mean to act as the "of the funds"? 

Also, could you provide more details about the deceased customer? How did they come into possession of such a large amount and why was there no in the event of their death?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Greetings Patricia.

This is to acknowledge the receipt of your mail received, Thanks for your
response. Firstly I got your mail from Google online directory trying to
locate any of the late deceased relatives and having been motivated by your
personal status, I decided to approach you for a possible partnership which
I know we'll benefit from. Note that every legal required document needed
for the claim will be obtained in your name which requires some little
amount to get all legal documents done. Before the transaction is processed
to your bank to bank wire transfer. Please be aware that this transaction
would be completed within three(3) working days upon our cooperation with
the management.

And this transaction will involve some little amount of money before it
gets into your account which both of us will share the expense of every
legal requirement document needed for the transaction to take place. Which
will cost us very little. After getting all the requirements needed for the
claim we can still process it to be loaded on a Visa Card. Which will be
sent to you through the DHL delivery service to you. Because upon making
the bank to bank wire transfer it will cost us so much which I will not
want us to spend so much as an insider and as the branch accountant to the
bank where the funds are. It will be very easy for us.

This fund was deposited here in Absa Bank Ghana Ltd, formerly known as
Barclays Bank Ghana Ltd. Osu Branch where am the Regional Remittance
Manager and was deposited by one Mr. David Gerald from Bahrain who came to
Ghana as a Foreign Investor and also a Contractor with Ghana Port Authority
here in Ghana the fund was deposited in the year 2008 then in 2009 he died
ever since then I been looking for way to meet any of his relative who
knows him as there was no next of kin on the fund when it was deposited.

The reason why am contacting you is since on one have come for the fund
since his death the Government wants to take over the fund but because I
notice this could be very big opportunity for you and I to make big money
then I decided to let the head office know that I know the deceased
relative I did it because you and I will benefit so much with the total
amount I don't want this fund to go into Government purse, This is why I
want you to stand as the deceased next of kin as I will back up every
question from bank auditors so please kindly send all your banking details
as i start with the process.

After receiving the funds through bank to bank wire transfer i will come
over and meet you face to face for sharing and verbal discussion then eat
together as family which my family and yours will always reach out
together, there is no risk involves, We're sharing 45% for you while 55%
comes for me But let there be trust between you and I please fill this bank
processing form for your name to be documented on system as the next of kin
of the fund to enable the head office release to us every requirement
needed. And the interest of the total amount throughout this period will be
added for us.

As every document will bear your name. Here is the proof of fund deposit
with the death certificate of the deceased. You're free to contact me any
time any day.

As i wait for your kind response,

Yours faithfully.
Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor
Regional/ Branch Manager
Absa Bank Ghana Ltd
WhatsApp/Mobile: 233(0)0503951117

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Thank you for reaching out and explaining the situation in such detail. I must say, it's quite an unexpected circumstance. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate demise of Mr. David Gerald.

I have a few questions before we proceed further. Could you please clarify what kind of legal documents would be required for this process? Also, could you provide an estimate of the costs involved in obtaining these documents?

You mentioned that the funds were deposited at Absa Bank Ghana Ltd, formerly known as Barclays Bank Ghana Ltd. Is there any specific reason why Mr. David Gerald chose this particular bank?

Lastly, I'm curious about how you found my contact information and why you believe I might be related to Mr. David Gerald.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must say, it's quite an interesting situation you've found yourself in. I'm sorry to hear about the unfortunate demise of Mr. David Gerald.

I have a few questions though, if you don't mind me asking. You mentioned that there are some legal documents required for the claim which will be obtained in my name. Could you please elaborate on what these documents are? 

Also, you mentioned that this process would involve a certain amount of money. Could you provide more details about this? How much exactly are we talking about here?

Lastly, could you explain how the Visa Card process works? I'm not very familiar with it and would appreciate some clarification.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must say, it's quite an interesting situation you've found yourself in. I'm curious about a few things though.

Firstly, how did you manage to find my email in the Google online directory? I wasn't aware that my information was publicly available there. 

Secondly, could you please elaborate on the legal documents that need to be obtained in my name? What kind of documents are these and what is their purpose?

Also, I'm intrigued by the idea of loading the funds onto a Visa Card and having it sent through DHL delivery service. How does this process work exactly?

Lastly, regarding the deceased Mr. David Gerald from Bahrain, do we have any more information about him? It's quite sad to hear that he passed away without any next of kin.

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Greetings Patricia.

This is to acknowledge the receipt of your mail received. Patricia please
forward to me your direct phone number that can be also used on whatsapp so
that i speak with you there.

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Patricia,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm always eager to chat and learn more about what's going on. However, I prefer to keep our conversation here for now. Is there something specific you wanted to discuss?

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello,  Good morning.
 How are you doing today? Hope you are in good hands.       I'm writing  in
regards of our previous conversation, concerning our pending transaction.
Respond to my email asap so that we can continue from where we stop. Thanks

As i wait for your kind response,

Yours faithfully.
Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor
Regional/ Branch Manager
Absa Bank Ghana Ltd

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Good morning to you too! I'm doing well, thank you for asking. I hope you're also having a good day.

I remember our previous conversation, but could you please refresh my memory about the specifics? What was it that we were discussing?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: Attention,
body:
Hello Mr. Elvis Lawer Nanor,

Thank you for reaching out and providing such detailed information about this matter. I must say, it's quite an unexpected situation to find myself in.

I'm curious about a few things though. How did you manage to find my contact information? And why was there no next of kin listed when the fund was deposited? It seems unusual that someone would deposit such a large amount without designating a beneficiary.

Also, could you please explain more about the process of obtaining the legal documents needed for the claim? What kind of documents are we talking about here?

Lastly, I'm not very familiar with bank-to-bank wire transfers or Visa Cards loaded with funds. Could you provide more details on how these processes work?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Patricia
